author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: َنْ أَيْقَظَتْهُ نَسْمَةُ اللّهِ الَّتِيْ مَرَّتْ مِنْ جِهَةِ فَضْلِهِ عَلَى المُقْبِلِينَ مِنْ خَلْقِهِ، أَيْ رَبِّ تَرَى عِبادَكَ أُسَرآءَ بِأَيادِي أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَأَهْوائِهِمْ خَلِّصْهُمْ يا إِلهِي بِسُلْطانِكَ وَقُدْرَتِكَ
translation: Thou seest, O my Lord, how Thy servants are held captive by their own selves and desires. Redeem them from their bondage, O my God, by the power of Thy sovereignty and might, that they may turn towards Thee when He Who is the Revealer of Thy names and attributes is manifested unto men.
